pkmkdoc.description: FB Handler allows you to click the Facebook profile links that appear in Address Book to open the user's profile page in your default web browser.

locale.resource:
{\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\cocoartf1038\cocoasubrtf350 {\fonttbl\f0\fnil\fcharset0 LucidaGrande;} {\colortbl;\red255\green255\blue255;} \pard\tx560\tx1120\tx1680\tx2240\tx2800\tx3360\tx3920\tx4480\tx5040\tx5600\tx6160\tx6720\ql\qnatural\pardirnatural
\f0\fs26 \cf0 If you've imported your Facebook contacts into Address Book you may have noticed lately that these contacts have a special Homepage link of the form:\ \ fb://profile/######\ \ These links seem like they should take you to a Facebook profile, but when you click on them nothing happens. The problem is that Mac OS X doesn't know how to handle FB:// links so it ignores them.\ \ "FB Handler" makes these Facebook profile links clickable and includes support for these other potential Facebook links:\ \ fb://wall/...\ fb://photos/...\ fb://friends/...\ fb://notes/...\ }

requirement.message: You must be running Mac OS X 10.4 or later to install FBHelper.
